alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:14PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 345 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Centre, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Tennala, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Coloma, Weiss Dam, Fullerton, New Moon, Yellow Creek Falls, Chesnut Bay Resort, Broomtown, Howells Crossroads and Waterhouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
